alert.note: Alert for Northern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 7:31PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Oxford and northeastern Coos Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 730 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pittsburg, or 10 miles northeast of Colebrook, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Colebrook, Errol, Pittsburg, Dixville, Columbia, Clarksville, Oxbow, Parkertown, Lynchtown, Parmachenee, Bowmantown, Stewartstown, Upper Cupsuptic, Wentworth Location and Lincoln Plantation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
